name: Scandi Style Coat Hook - AMERICAN OAK
description:
American oak coat hook with leather tab and brass eyelet detailing.

- Handcrafted by Australian furniture designer Chris Colwell

- Smooth raw finish

- Measures 10cm x 15cm

FREE SHIPPING AUSTRALIA WIDE

Please email with all international freight enquiries.

name: Boucherouite Rag Rug - BULLS EYE
description:
- Curator's Collection

- One-of-a-kind

- Vintage, textile remnants

- Origin, MRIRT, MOROCCO

- Dimensions 190cm X 160cm

***Please note this piece has been heat sealed by hand in areas by its weaver which has slightly altered the original texture of the fabric***

The boucherouite rugs in our Curator’s Collection have been hand-selected for their collectible value and aesthetic appeal as original artworks, showcasing unique designs and/or the use of mixed weaving techniques and materials including wool.

* * *

Boucherouite, (pronounced boo-shay-reet), is a rug style specific to rural tribes of Morocco.

Hand-loomed by Berber women from recycled remnants including cotton, synthetic fibres and occasionally wool and plastic, these remarkable one-of-a-kind creations are celebrated for their improvisatory patterns and soul-stirring shades.

Unlike most European techniques, the boucherouite, also known as the “rag rug”, is not based on a predetermined pattern or design. Rather, it is created at the whim of its weaver whose choice of colours and textures impart an emotive painterly feel.

The universal beauty of these tribal textiles has seen them transcend the realm of domesticity in recent times to that of the gallery, testament that the boucherouite is equally at home on the wall as it is underfoot.

For more information visit: http://issuu.com/cavinmorris/docs/3_rags_to_richesse

FREE SHIPPING AUSTRALIA WIDE

Please email with all international shipping enquiries.

- One-of-a-kind

- 100% wool

***

Hand-loomed by Berber tribes of the Azilal province in the High Atlas Mountains of Morocco, these ultra plush single-knot carpets are made from un-dyed virgin wool and traditionally feature dark brown/black designs with the occasional, limited use of colour.

FREE SHIPPING AUSTRALIA WIDE

These multi-purpose baskets handcrafted in Morocco will instantly enliven any space with their bold colour palettes. Fun and functional, they can be wall-mounted for added effect.

- Palm fibre wrapped in recycled plastic

- Diameter 48cm/ height 9cm (approx)

- One-of-a-kind designs

- Handmade in Morocco

- FREE SHIPPING AUSTRALIA WIDE

EMAIL WITH ALL INTERNATIONAL FREIGHT ENQUIRIES

Please note...

These artisanal crafts may display subtle variations or irregularities consistent with the handmade aesthetic. We believe this is part of their charm and wanderlust appeal.

Handmade by local artisans throughout rural regions of India, these one-of-a-kind textiles wear their history with pride and may have subtle imperfections; we believe this is part of their charm and wanderlust appeal.

name: Boucherouite Rag Rug - RIBBON
description:
- Vintage, MOROCCO

- One-of-a-kind

- Dimensions 150cm x 105cm

***

Boucherouite, (pronounced boo-shay-reet), is a rug style specific to rural tribes of Morocco.

Hand-loomed by Berber women from recycled remnants including cotton, synthetic fibres and occasionally wool and plastic, these remarkable one-of-a-kind creations are celebrated for their improvisatory patterns and soul-stirring shades.

Unlike most European techniques, the boucherouite, also known as the “rag rug”, is not based on a predetermined pattern or design. Rather, it is created at the whim of its weaver whose choice of colours and textures impart an emotive painterly feel.

The universal beauty of these tribal textiles has seen them transcend the realm of domesticity in recent times to that of the gallery, testament that the boucherouite is equally at home on the wall as it is underfoot.

For more information visit: http://issuu.com/cavinmorris/docs/3_rags_to_richesse

FREE SHIPPING AUSTRALIA WIDE

Please email with all international shipping enquiries.

***

Hand-loomed by Berber tribes of the Azilal province in the High Atlas Mountains of Morocco, these ultra plush single-knot carpets are made from un-dyed virgin wool and traditionally feature dark brown/black designs with the occasional, limited use of colour.
